newsitem.title: USA: Broward Cty, Fla. voters ok one of two bond issues.
newsitem.headline: Broward Cty, Fla. voters ok one of two bond issues.

text.p: Voters in Hollywood, Fla., soundly rejected a $37 million bond issue for capital improvements while voters in neighboring Davie, Fla., approved a $9.8 million issue for a municipal center, Broward County elections officials said Wednesday.
Both were general obligation bond issues.

The Hollywood proposal failed with 8,782 votes against or 70.8 percent, and 3,616 votes for, or 29.2 percent. It would have financed public safety projects, beach improvement and parks and recreation projects that included a baseball and track complex.
Davie voters approved their proposal with 2,574 yes votes or 68.4 percent and 1,199 no votes or 31.6 percent of the ballots cast in Tuesday's referendum.
Bond proceeds will be used to build a 58,000-square-foot center to house a fire station, community room and town hall annex.
The city plans to issue requests for proposals later this month and choose an underwriter in October, with the bond sale expected in January.
